thread.title: Free CUSTOM music/sound effects for your games/maps

post.author: Shadowbunny
post.body:
Hi everyone.
Not sure where to put this topic (feel free to move it if I have put it in the wrong area - my apologies).
Just wanted to let you all know that I am a music producer of several genres of electronic-orientated music (industrial, techno, electro, trip-hop, acid, breakbeat, ambient, IDM), and I am free to work with anyone who would like to have music or sound effects for their games/maps.
Right now I have only done this for two people. I thought it was fun and everything so i'd like to do it for others as well. Basicly all I do is sit in my room programming music/sounds into my Alesis Andromeda (which is a rare analog monster synth - which means you will get rare and neato sounds!), as well as my Yamaha RS7000. So to me it is fun, and right now i'm not seeking payment for this type of thing, just a credit on your website and/or read me file is okay with me, and I will also add you in my portfolio of people I have worked with.
I am capable of creating sci-fi ambience, sound effects like metal scrapes, machinery, spaceships, robots, computers glitching, etc. Voices, as well as almost any genre of electronic music you would need.
Feel free to contact me through here in a P.M. or email me shadowbunny(at)shadowbunny(dot)org . I also have AIM: shad0wbunny (but i'm rarely on there...). If I don't answer right away, don't fret, it's probably because i'm away from the internet due to travelling or playing shows, but I promise i'll try and respond within 72 hours at least.
Thanks for taking the time to read this long as hell post

xoxoxoxo-Shadowbunny

post.author: jizaboz
post.body:
Shadowbunny's brother here. Just saw this post here today. If you guys would like a small example of some her "spacey" sounds, go here http://home.triad.rr.com/fragmeister/do ... /index.htm . She did the sounds for both of the ships shown hovering over my old Mars map for enemy territory. Download it and check it out. They were originally 2 long stereo clips that I clipped smaller and looped, then converted to the ol' 8-bit mono format. I was really happy with the results.
She's going to be helping me with sounds and ambience for the big Doom III - Mydevil RPG mod I'm working on, but my progress with that has been SO slow with that she's got time to do other stuff ;)


Shadowbunny: A shader is just a short script that tells Doom 3 how to play your sound. Most map makers do their own, but if you distribute them in a big .pak4 (like a .zip) it's nice to have the shader scripts included. I can do them for you if yr interested in that or show you how to do them.

Kat or BNA or whoever: Any chance of making this thread sticky here?
